chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
p: nat
q: nat

Goal:
{n : nat & {r : nat | q = n * p + r /\ (p <> 0 -> r < p)}}

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
euclid : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | n = q * d + r /\ r < d}}
bezout_generalized_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat & {u : nat & {v : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ is_gcd p q g /\ is_lcm p q l /\ p = u * g /\ q = v * g /\ a <= v /\ b <= u}}}}}}
is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => divides p r /\ divides q r /\ (forall k : nat, divides p k -> divides q k -> divides r k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
bezout_generalized : forall p q : nat, {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ is_gcd p q g /\ is_lcm p q l}}}}
Nat.sqrt_iter_spec : forall k p q r : nat, q = p + p -> r <= q -> let s := Nat.sqrt_iter k p q r in s * s <= k + p * p + (q - r) < S s * S s
bezout_rel_prime : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q}}
arem = fun n d q j : nat => j <= d /\ (n = 2 * q * d + j \/ q <> 0 /\ n = 2 * q * d - j) : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments arem (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.sqrt_iter = fix sqrt_iter (k p q r : nat) {struct k} : nat := match k with | 0 => p | S k' => match r with | 0 => sqrt_iter k' (S p) (S (S q)) (S (S q)) | S r' => sqrt_iter k' p q r' end end : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sqrt_iter (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
is_gcd_sym : forall p q r : nat, is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd q p r
is_lcm_sym : forall p q r : nat, is_lcm p q r -> is_lcm q p r
is_gcd_moduplus : forall p q k r : nat, divides p k -> is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd p (q + k) r
division_by_even : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {j : nat | arem n d q j}}
is_gcd_modulus : forall p q k r : nat, divides p k -> k <= q -> is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd p (q - k) r
Nat.tail_addmul_spec : forall r n m : nat, Nat.tail_addmul r n m = r + n * m
Init.Nat.tail_addmul = fix tail_addmul (r n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => r | S n0 => tail_addmul (Init.Nat.tail_add m r) n0 m end : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.tail_addmul (_ _ _)%nat_scope
is_gcd_0 : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 0 -> p = 0 /\ q = 0
Nat.eq_dec : forall n m : nat, {n = m} + {n <> m}
Nat.mul_lt_pred : forall p q n m : nat, S p = q -> p * n < p * m < -> q * n + m < q * m + n
Wf_Z.Z_of_nat_complete_inf : forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 x -> {n : nat | x = BinInt.Z.of_nat n}
Nat.Bezout = fun n m p : nat => exists a b : nat, a * n = p + b * m : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.Bezout (_ _ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.divmod = fix divmod (x y q u : nat) {struct x} : nat * nat := match x with | 0 => (q, u) | S x' => match u with | 0 => divmod x' y (S q) y | S u' => divmod x' y q u' end end : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> nat * nat Arguments Init.Nat.divmod (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
lt_eq_lt_dec : forall n m : nat, {n < m} + {n = m} + {m < n}
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
odd_even_lem : forall p q : nat, 2 * p + 1 <> 2 * q
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
mult_acc = fix mult_acc (s m n : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => s | S p => mult_acc (tail_plus m s) m p end : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat Arguments mult_acc (_ _ _)%nat_scope
bezout_nc : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> exists a b : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q
